case_title: SHAH MUHAMMAD KHAN vs GHULAM QADIR ETC.
complaint_summary: Ghulam Qadir filed a suit for declaration claiming half of the compensation for land surrendered by his father, Mian Allah Bakhsh, under Martial Law Regulation 64, alleging the land was gifted to him.
investigation_summary: Issues were struck on 21-6-1963. Defendant sought amendment of the written statement on 17-10-1963, leading to additional issues framed on 23-11-1963 regarding jurisdiction. Defendant later filed an application under Order XIV, rule 2, on 19-6-1964, which was dismissed by the trial judge on 3-7-1964.
judgment_summary: The court dismissed the petition, stating the trial court properly exercised discretion in interlocutory matters. The petitioner caused unnecessary delays in proceedings, and the application lacked merit and suffered from laches. The petition was dismissed with costs.
legal_arguments: Faqir Chand v. Mst. Bibi Zulekha

legal_terms.laches: Unreasonable delay in asserting a legal right.

words_and_phrases.interlocutory matters: Issues decided during the course of a trial, not final judgment.

summary_vector_notes: The case involved a dispute over compensation for land surrendered under Martial Law Regulation 64. Ghulam Qadir claimed half the compensation, alleging the land was gifted to him by his father, Mian Allah Bakhsh. The petitioner sought amendments and raised jurisdictional issues late in the proceedings. The court upheld the trial court's discretion and dismissed the petition with costs.

facts.claim: Ghulam Qadir claimed half of the compensation for surrendered land, alleging it was gifted to him by his father.

legal_provisions.order_xiv_rule_2: Application for deciding legal issues before proceeding with the case.

precedents.case: Faqir Chand v. Mst. Bibi Zulekha
